description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3gsrn","text":"Here we describe a protocol for SMRT-Tag: Single-Molecule Real-Time sequencing by Tagmentation - a transposase-mediatedstrategy for producing low-input, multiplexable, PCR-free PacBio sequencing libraries. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":42,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":49,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":58,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":63,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":82,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bed82","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d482","text":"SMRT-Tag requires only 1-10% as much input material as existing PacBio protocols (typically at least 1–5 µg, or 150,000–750,000 human cells) and enables highly-sensitive and simultaneous detection of sequence variation and CpG methylation comparable to the current state-of-the-art.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lfss","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nced","text":"In brief, high-quality genomic DNA is tagmented using Tn5 transposase loaded with custom hairpin adaptors, gap-repaired to generate closed and circular templates,  exo-digested to remove unrepaired molecules, and then sequenced on the PacBio Sequel II platform. All steps from purified gDNA to sequencing-ready libraries can be performed in one day. We have demonstrated the utility of SMRT-Tag on input as low as 40ng gDNA (~ 7000 cell equivalents) sequenced monoplex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aeire","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s90r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jfle","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"20ite","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cvjg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2B8E8E3B214911EF83720A58A9FEAC02","height":543,"id":473546,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"1s8mq\",\"text\":\"Schematic workflow of the SMRT-Tag sequencing library preparation.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screenshot 2024-06-02 at 9.31.37 PM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qqqnbwfqf.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qqqkbwfqf.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qqqmbwfqf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qqqjbwfqf.webp","width":550}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f7pee","text":"Reconstitute HPLC-purified SMRT-Tag adaptors (IDT) to 100 µM in nuclease-free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45hpo","text":"Dilute adaptors to 20 µM in 1x annealing buffer (10mM Tris-HCl pH 7.5 and 100mM NaCl) in PCR tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brcov","text":"Place the tubes in a thermocycler at 95°C with a heated lid at 105ºC for 5 min, then remove them from the heat source and slowly cool to room temperature for at least 30 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5g6tq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"55bku","text":"[NOTE] Annealed adaptors can be stored at -20°C for up to 6 months.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Assembling SMRT-Tn5 transposomes (Tn5 loaded with SMRT-Tag adaptors)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8t1tk","text":"Thaw Tn5 enzyme stock (3.9mg/mL) suspended in Storage Buffer (50mM Tris-HCl​ pH 7.5, 800mM NaCl, 0.2mM EDTA, 2mM DTT, 10% glycerol) on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6oc1d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Assembling SMRT-Tn5 transposomes (Tn5 loaded with SMRT-Tag adaptors)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"audkm","text":"Dilute to ~1mg/mL (or 18.9 µM monomer) in Tn5 dilution buffer (50mM Tris-HCl pH 7.5, 200mM NaCl, 0.1mM EDTA, 2mM DTT, and 50% glycerol) and slowly mix 10-15 times with a wide-bore pipette. The mixture is extremely viscous. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t58t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Assembling SMRT-Tn5 transposomes (Tn5 loaded with SMRT-Tag adaptors)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eikas","text":"Let sit on a rotational mixer at 4ºC for at least 3 hr until the mixture becomes fully homogenized.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Assembling SMRT-Tn5 transposomes (Tn5 loaded with SMRT-Tag adaptors)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"29mpa","text":"Mix 1.02x volume of 1mg/mL Tn5 with 1x volume of 20 µM annealed SMRT-Tag adaptors using a wide-bore pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2b2js","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Assembling SMRT-Tn5 transposomes (Tn5 loaded with SMRT-Tag adaptors)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eou8t","text":"Incubate the mixture at 23ºC for 55 min with continuous shaking at 350 rpm. After 55 min, place on ice. Loaded SMRT-Tn5 (~9.4µM monomer) can be supplemented with glycerol up to a final concentration of 50% and stored at −20° for up to 6 months. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cd8sa","text":"Add 1-2 µL of each loaded SMRT-Tn5 transposome with 2.5µL of 4x Native Gel Loading Buffer and dilute up to 10 µL with dH2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ae17","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9foi6","text":"Load each prepared sample on a NativePAGE 4-16% Bis-Tris Gel along with GeneRuler Ultra Low Range DNA Ladder, a negative DNA control (Tn5 without SMRT-Tag adaptors), a negative protein control (annealed SMRT-Tag oligos without Tn5), a positive control (Tn5 loaded with any confirmed adaptors i.e Nextera N5/N7 oligos) if available.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"74k7v","text":"Add 200mL of cold cathode buffer (1x NativePAGE running buffer and 0.1x NativePAGE cathode additive) to the inner chamber. Add 600mL of cold anode buffer (1x NativePAGE running buffer) to the outer chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e51hb","text":"Run the gel at 150V for 1 hr at 4ºC, followed by 180V for 15 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f8ni0","text":"Stain the gel with 1x SYBR Gold Solution for ~30 min on a shaker. Visualize on a LiCor or any imaging system to confirm the proper loading of SMRT-Tn5 transposomes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"al3fr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f1hr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"28nj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7brau","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cvrd7","text":"Reference fig.1: loaded SMRT-Tn5 on a NativePAGE 4-16% Bis-Tris Gel.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2htul","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"qux58","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"enju","text":"[NOTE] Not all samples loaded on the reference gel are required. The negative DNA control (Tn5 monomer without adaptors) should not be detected. The positive control (Tn5 loaded with Nextera N5/N7 adaptors) shows a lower DNA band than Tn5 loaded with SMRT-Tag adaptors due to the shorter oligo sequence. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"DFBA194A345411EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":305,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"esv9u\",\"text\":\"Left to Right: GeneRuler ULR ladder; 2 replicates of Tn5 loaded with barcoded SMRT-Tag adaptors; 2 replicates of Tn5 loaded with unbarcoded SMRT-Tag adaptors (shorter than barcoded SMRT-Tag adaptors); 2 replicates of Tn5 loaded with Nextera N5/N7 adaptors (shorter than SMRT-Tag adaptors); Tn5 monomer without adaptors;  2 replicates of annealed, barcoded SMRT-Tag oligos without Tn5; 2 replicates of annealed, unbarcoded SMRT-Tag oligos without Tn5; GeneRuler ULR ladder.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"211005_SN_gelshift_PR004-PR009-PR010-PR011_pub.jpeg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/itn8bv6yx.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/itn6bv6yx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/itn7bv6yx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/itn5bv6yx.webp","width":550},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"image"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fun7u","text":"Stain the gel with 1x Coomassie Blue for 1 hr at RT on a shaker, destain for at least 20 min with dH2O, and image using visible light to confirm the presence of protein band.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqrnk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5ias","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fm530","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d2n9l","text":"Reference fig. 2: loaded SMRT-Tn5 transposomes on a NativePAGE after Coomassie stain.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"nqam","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"odkdd","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"4q5en","text":"[NOTE] Not all samples loaded on the reference gel are required. All six loaded Tn5 transposomes can be visualized. The negative protein controls (annealed SMRT-Tag oligos without Tn5) are NOT visualized by the Coomassie stain. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"DFBBA1CA345411EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":357,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"1t852\",\"text\":\"Same gel as above, visualized with Coomassie stain. Left to Right: 2 replicates of Tn5 loaded with barcoded SMRT-Tag adaptors; 2 replicates of Tn5 loaded with unbarcoded SMRT-Tag adaptors; 2 replicates of Tn5 loaded with Nextera N5/N7 adaptors (shorter than SMRT-Tag adaptors); Tn5 monomer without adaptors (very faint).\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"211005_SN_gelshift_PR004-PR009-PR010-PR011_coomassie_pub.jpeg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/itpcbv6yx.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/itpabv6yx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/itpbbv6yx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/itn9bv6yx.webp","width":550},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"image"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ch5ij","text":"For each tagmentation reaction, add 2 µL of 5x TAPS buffer (50mM TAPS-NaOH pH 8.5, 25mM MgCl2), 1 µL of 100% DMF, 160ng of genomic DNA (gDNA) as a template, 1 µL of serially diluted SMRT-Tn5 (i.e 1x, 4x, 16x, 64x), and dilute up to 10 µL with dH2O. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":92,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8q2h9","text":"Incubate reactions (10 µL) at a range of temperatures (i.e. 37°C, 55°C) for a range of incubation periods (i.e 30 min, 60 min). To validate activity, we recommend 37ºC and 55ºC for 30 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"clhfd","text":"Terminate the reactions by adding 2.5 µL of 0.2% SDS and incubate for 5 min at RT. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"s9ti","text":"Mix each reaction (12.5 µL) with 2.5 µL of 6x loading dye and load on a 0.5% agarose gel. Use 5µL of NEB 1kb-Extend for the ladder. Run at 60-80V for 2-3 hr.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4etbe","text":"Stain the gel with 1x SYBR Gold Solution in TAE buffer for ~30 min on a shaker. Visualize on a LiCor or any imaging system to confirm the gel shift of transposase activity - DNA size distribution post tagmentation varies as a function of SMRT-Tn5 concentration. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eo8fv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7rdb6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8hkhk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"98tai","text":"Reference fig. 3: transposase activity assay.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"skzgw","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2go75","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"DFC2D85C345411EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":517,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"5g1lc\",\"text\":\"Two tagmentation temperatures (37C vs. 55C) and 8 serially diluted SMRT-Tn5 concentrations (9.4pmol = 1x, 0.075pmol = 128x dilution factor) are tested. A clear gel shift is observed as transposase concentration decreases from left to right across the lanes.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2022-07-28 at 11.28.32 PM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/itpgbv6yx.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/itpebv6yx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/itpfbv6yx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/itpdbv6yx.webp","width":550},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"image"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2riq9","text":"High Molecular Weight genomic DNA (HMW gDNA) is used as standard input for the SMRT-Tag method. High quality DNA is essential for efficient sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9bok6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3mjq","text":"To reduce gDNA viscosity, incubate at 37ºC for 5-10 min at low agitation speed (300 rpm).
